title: Bug 10403: Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
EB: The project creation process should display a confirmation message indicating that the output directory will be deleted and rebuilt.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Open the project creation dialog.
2. Specify an existing directory structure for the project.
3. Point the output folder at a bin directory that contains additional files.
4. Proceed with creating the project.

Expected result:
A confirmation message should appear, stating that the output directory will be deleted and rebuilt.

Actual result:
The confirmation message is not displayed, and the project is created without scrubbing the bin directory.
